results.title: Australia marches with Britain
results.creator_credit: National Films Council and Ken G. Hall
results.brief_description: Highlights of the National War Effort. Reaping the wheat, shearing sheep, producing butter, eggs, felling trees for timber. Industry producing metals, Bren Gun carriers, shells, guns, ships, planes, exporting the lot to England. Total war effort to fight enemy. Australian Army, Navy and Air Force personnel training and embarking for service overseas. Commentary by Peter Bathurst.

results.title: Australia makes aircraft
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Malcolm Otton and Richard Mitchell
results.brief_description: The Department of Supply is the centre of the Australian aircraft industry. Film shows the manufacture of military aircraft in Australia. Includes production and assembly of a Mirage supersonic fighter and its Atar engine and shows briefly the design, testing and maintenance facilities of the department.

results.title: Australia in the 80's
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Peter Johnson and John Leake
results.brief_description: This film presents the variety and vigour of a nation still developing. Includes sequences of travel on the famous Indian Pacific railway between Port Pirie and Kalgoorlie, the nomad aircraft coastal surveillance, the gasfields of Moomba, and the Sepeltsfield wine-growing area in the Barossa Valley

results.title: Australia in New Guinea
results.brief_description: Traces the development of North East New Guinea under mandate to Australia by the League of Nations. The film contrasts conditions in pre-war years with reconstruction and development during recent years; cutting and milling of timber; construction of pre-fabricated houses and other buildings; education of natives; an experimental project for raising sheep, shearing and weaving wool. No other credits available.

results.title: Australia has no winter
results.creator_credit: Habibi Films, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Sherine Salama and Amos Cohen
results.brief_description: Stevan Arbutina, a Serb, is married to Georgia, a Croatian. They are forced to immigrate to Australia after the devastating civil war in Yugoslavia makes it impossible for them to find peace and security in their old country. This compelling documentary traces the Arbutina family’s journey from Belgrade to Melbourne. Initially excited about arriving in a country fabled for prosperity and peace, the family soon discover that lack of employment opportunities and the barrier of language isolate them from the new world they have entered. By spending a year with the family, and by covering every aspect of the refugee process - arrival, social security, community services, learning to shop and travel - the filmmakers deliver an intimate and revealing portrait of the contemporary refugee experience; from the joy of survival to the depression arising from isolation and unemployment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Habibi Films, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Sherine Salama and Amos Cohen

results.title: Australia Felix
results.brief_description: Tom Robert’s paintings portray aspects of Australia’s history. Surveys many of his paintings which show the early history of the Australian way of life. Tom Roberts (1856-1931) travelled in Spain and applied the knowledge gained overseas in starting a new trend in Australian painting - scenes of casual human interest.

results.title: Australia daze
results.creator_credit: Fiske/Isaac, Graeme Isaac and Pat Fiske
results.brief_description: On the 26th January 1988, Australia celebrated its bicentenary in a variety of different ways. This program looks at some of them, from the re-enactment of the arrival of the first fleet in Sydney Harbour, seen through the eyes of wealthy socialites on their motor launch, and more ordinary Australians at their barbecue to scenes of the official speeches and the progress of the Aboriginal “March for Freedom, Justice and Hope” In between we see European immigrants and their celebrations, a street party and the outback cattle ranchers to whom it is just another working day.

results.title: Australia calling
results.brief_description: A panorama of Australia, moving from Western Australia through South Australia, Tasmania, Victoria, the A.C.T., N.S.W. and Queensland. Scenes include timber getting, gold mining, grape and apple harvests, dairying, skiing, Federal Parliament, Sydney attractions, Blue Mountains, caves and beaches, cane cutting and the Great Barrier Reef.

results.title: Australia builds
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Film Board and Dept of Public Information
results.brief_description: Australia is playing her part as a member of the United Nations family by giving a home and new life to many Europeans. But to continue to feed her growing population she has had to develop her resources to a greater extent; the Snowy Mountains project is one way in which she is doing this. Australia has also found it necessary to buy machinery and equipment from dollar countries. Dollars are in short supply, but as a member of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, the Government has been able to negotiate a series of dollar loans.
